page.title: 06VENTNOR WINTER GARDENS.
page.content: In 1935 a competition was held for a design for Winter Gardens in Ventnor. It was built on the site of the Vicarage and is considered to be a typical building of that era. It consists of a concert hall, bar and cafeteria. Today it is being restored to its original condition. During the winter it is used by the local population as a community centre. In the summer concerts are arranged for the holiday-makers. These acts are appearing this year: Cliff Lazarenko, Ted and Jean Redfern, Island Swing Jazz Band and Ryde Concert Band. The bar is called the Bell Bar because the warning bell from the end of the pier hangs there. Plants are being installed so that it can again become a true winter garden.
